t: Psalm 116
Thanksgiving for Deliverance from Death.
I*pn love the Lord,*s because He hears My*ln voice and*i my supplications.
Because*ln He has inclined His ear to me, Therefore*ln I shall call upon*i Him*i as long as I live.
The*ln cords of death encompassed me And*ln the terrors of Sheol came upon me; I*ln found distress and sorrow.
Then*ln I called upon the name of the Lord:*s “O*ln Lord,*s I beseech You, save my life!”
Gracious*ln is the Lord,*s and righteous; Yes,*ln our God is compassionate.
The*ln Lord*s preserves the simple; I*ln was brought low, and He saved me.
Return*ln to your rest, O my soul, For*ln the Lord*s has dealt bountifully with you.
For*ln You have rescued my soul from death, My*ln eyes from tears, My*ln feet from stumbling.
I*ln shall walk before the Lord*s In*ln the land of the living.
I*ln believed when I said, “I*ln am greatly afflicted.”
I*ln said in my alarm, “All*ln men are liars.”
What*ln shall I render to the Lord*s For*ln all His benefits toward me?
I*ln shall lift up the cup of salvation And*ln call upon the name of the Lord.*s
I*ln shall pay my vows to the Lord,*s Oh*ln may*i it*i be*i in the presence of all His people.
Precious*ln in the sight of the Lord*s Is*ln the death of His godly ones.
O*ln Lord,*s surely I am Your servant, I*ln am Your servant, the son of Your handmaid, You*ln have loosed my bonds.
To*ln You I shall offer a sacrifice of thanksgiving, And*ln call upon the name of the Lord.*s
I*ln shall pay my vows to the Lord,*s Oh*ln may*i it*i be*i in the presence of all His people,
In*ln the courts of the Lord’s*s house, In*ln the midst of you, O Jerusalem. Praise*ln the Lord!*s
